concise_definition: adj. 自豪的, 骄傲的, 自负的

definitions.explanation_en: Feeling deep satisfaction or pleasure derived from one's own achievements, qualities, or possessions, or from those of someone closely associated with oneself.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因自己的成就、品质或拥有之物，或因与自己密切相关之人的成就而感到深深的满足或喜悦。
definitions.example_en: She was proud of her son for winning the science competition.
definitions.example_cn: 她为儿子赢得科学竞赛而感到自豪。

definitions.explanation_en: Having or showing an excessively high opinion of oneself; arrogant or haughty in attitude.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对自己持有过高评价；态度傲慢或自负。
definitions.example_en: His proud demeanor made it difficult for others to approach him.
definitions.example_cn: 他傲慢的态度让别人难以接近他。

definitions.explanation_en: Characterized by a strong sense of dignity or self-respect; not willing to accept something considered beneath one's status.
definitions.explanation_cn: 表现出强烈的尊严或自尊；不愿接受被认为有损身份的事物。
definitions.example_en: He was too proud to accept charity, even when he was unemployed.
definitions.example_cn: 即使失业，他也不愿接受施舍，太有自尊了。

comparison.analysis: “Confident”（自信的）指对自己能力或判断有充分信心，通常带有积极、健康的心理状态，不包含优越感或贬低他人。“Proud” 可以包含自信，但更强调情感上的满足或自我评价，有时可能带有负面的傲慢色彩。
“Arrogant”（傲慢的）是“proud”的负面极端形式，明确带有轻视他人、自以为是的贬义。“Proud” 在正面语境中是中性或褒义的，而 “arrogant” 几乎总是贬义，强调对他人的不尊重。
“Honored”（感到荣幸的）强调因被赋予某种地位、机会或认可而产生的感激与尊重，通常源于外部给予的尊重。“Proud” 则源于内在的自我评价或归属感，不依赖他人认可。例如：‘I am honored to receive this award’ vs. ‘I am proud of my work.’
